RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States Court of Appeals for the F: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the Court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the case is being tried, differentiated from police states
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that convicted Maria De Jesus Garcia, involved in the appeal of her case, made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search, gave initial instructions to the jury, has discretion to give the Allen charge, and was alleged to have erred by refusing post-verdict discovery, considers factors such as lateness of the hour
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: government whose agents conducted the stop and search, defendant in the appeal, responsible for enforcing laws through governmental enforcement agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in the stop and search of a pickup truck camper, conducted immigration inspections and roving patrols near the United States-Mexican border, had agents who apprehended illegal alien smugglers and were entitled to question occupants about their citizenship and immigration status after stopping a vehicle, observed suspicious behavior such as occupants trying to hide
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: a court that articulated principles for investigatory stops, relied upon an agent's observation, is handling the appeal of Maria De Jesus Garcia's case, has made a ruling on probable cause, and has upheld the use of the modified Allen charge in jury instructions, reviewing the issue of roving border patrol agents' stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico Border: geographic location related to the case, relevant for determining the origin of vehicles and individuals, used as a reference point for distance calculation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Standard: legal standard or precedent used to determine reasonable suspicion in immigration inspections and stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court Jury: jury that was given the Allen charge after indicating deadlock, deliberated for approximately three hours after receiving the charge, and requested a clarification of the United States district court's initial instructions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Federal Courts: courts that have not favored interrogations of jurors except where there is some showing of illegal or prejudicial intrusion into the jury process
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in the case whose motion to interview jurors was denied by the United States district court judge, owner of a pickup truck used in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's Vehicle: pickup truck driven by Maria De Jesus Garcia, subject of a stop and search by border patrol agents where occupants exhibited suspicious behavior, including hygienic appearances that were considered in assessing reasonable suspicion for the stop, had passengers who attempted to hide when a light was shone into the vehicle
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where Maria De Jesus Garcia was stopped, known as a common smuggling route
